sen.j: 京滋バイパス（けいじバイパス、英称 KEIJI BY-PASS）は滋賀県草津市から京都府久世郡久御山町に至る一般国道のバイパス道路である。
sen.e: The Keiji Bypass is the bypass of a national highway that extends from Kusatsu City, Shiga Prefecture to Kumiyama Town, Kuze-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 本訳出にあたり、一般国道は、有料道路との区別と考え、特に訳さずNational Highway としました。また英称も特に訳出の必要はないので訳出していません。
sen.e: The Keiji Bypass is the bypass of a national highway that extends from Kusatsu City, Shiga Prefecture to Kumiyama Town, Kuze-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Keiji Bypass is the bypass of a national highway that extends from Kusatsu City in Shiga Prefecture to Kumiyama Town, Kuse-gun in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 地名のスペルミスを修正

sen.j: 地域高規格道路の計画路線に指定されている。
sen.e: It is a planning route designated as a local high-standard highway and.
It is a planning route designated as a local high-standard highway.
It is a planning route designated as a local high-standard highway.

sen.j: 以下、まず有料道路の京滋バイパスについて述べ、次に国道1号・国道24号のバイパス道路の京滋バイパスについて述べる。
sen.e: Here below descrived at first is the Keiji Bypass as a toll road then as a bypass of National Highway 1 and 24.
The Keiji Bypass was first described as a toll road but then as a bypass of national highways 1 and 24.
The first description below refers to a toll road called the Keiji Bypass and the second refers to a bypass joining National Highways 1 and 24 that is also called the Keiji Bypass.
sen.cmt: 「以下」を補足。逆接でないのにbutが使用されていたので、修正。

sen.j: 名神高速道路と一体化されており、大津市街・京都市市街を迂回して、名神の栗東インターチェンジ・名古屋市方面と吹田インターチェンジ・大阪市方面とを接続する。
sen.e: Its toll road section is integrated in the Meishin Expressway to connect the Ritto Interchange (in the direction of Nagoya City) and the Suita Interchange (in the direction of Osaka City) of the Meishin Expressway by passing round the urban areas of Otsu City and Kyoto City.

Its toll road section is integrated in the Meishin Expressway to connect the Ritto Interchange (in the direction of Nagoya City) and the Suita Interchange (in the direction of Osaka City) of the Meishin Expressway by passing round the urban areas of Otsu City and Kyoto City.

Its toll road section is integrated in the Meishin Expressway to connect the Ritto Interchange (in the direction of Nagoya City) and the Suita Interchange (in the direction of Osaka City) of the Meishin Expressway by passing round the urban areas of Otsu City and Kyoto City.

sen.j: 法令上は、瀬田東インターチェンジ - 久御山淀インターチェンジは国道1号・国道478号で地域高規格道路（京滋バイパス）、久御山淀IC - 大山崎ジャンクションは国道478号で国土交通大臣指定に基づく高規格幹線道路（一般国道の自動車専用道路）（京都縦貫自動車道京都第二外環状道路）、大山崎JCT - 久御山淀ICは高速自動車国道（中央自動車道高速自動車国道の路線名）となっている。
sen.e: In terms of laws, the Seta-higashi Interchange to Kumiyamayodo Interchange section, a part of National Highway 1 and 478, is a regional high standard road; the Kumiyamayodo Interchange to Oyamazaki Junction, a part of National Highway 478, is a high-standard highway designated by Minister of Land, Infrastructure and Transportation, (National highway only for vehicles) (Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line of Kyoto jukan-jidoushdo Expressway); and the Oyamazaki Junction to Kumiyamyodo Junction section is a national express highway (a section called Keiji bypass of the Chuo jidosha-do National Expressway).
sen.cmt: 「路線名となっている」、は厳密には京滋バイパスはこの区間の名前と意訳しました。カッコ内に注の文が入ったため、一原文一訳文のｊ除外対処http://www.kyoto.kkr.mlit.go.jp/contents/nisoto/index.html
sen.e: In terms of laws, the section from the Seta-higashi Interchange to the Kumiyamayodo Interchange, being part of National Highways 1 and 478, is a regional high-standard road; the Kumiyamayodo Interchange to Oyamazaki Junction, a part of National Highway 478, is a high-standard highway designated by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transportation (a national highway only for vehicles) (Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line of Kyoto jukan-jidoushdo Expressway); and the section from Oyamazaki Junction to Kumiyamyodo Junction is a national express highway (a section called the Keiji Bypass of the Chuo Jidosha-do National Expressway).

In terms of laws, the section from the Seta-higashi Interchange to the Kumiyamayodo Interchange, being part of the national highways 1 and 478, is a regional high-standard road; the Kumiyamayodo Interchange to Oyamazaki Junction, a part of National Highway 478, is a high-standard highway designated by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transportation (a national highway only for vehicles) (Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line of the Kyoto jukan-jidoushdo Expressway); and the section from Oyamazaki Junction to Kumiyamyodo Interchange is a national express highway (a section called the Keiji Bypass of the Chuo Jidosha-do National Expressway).

sen.j: 後の計画で、名神高速道路の渋滞緩和と京都市の放射線・環状線の機能を持つ道路づくりの必要性から、国道9号バイパスであった京都丹波道路と京滋バイパスを結ぶ路線、京都第二外環状道路が作られることになった。
sen.e: To reduce congestions of the Meishin Expressway and to respond to the need of a road network having functions of a radial road and belt line in Kyoto City, the construction of the Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line was plann latar to connect the Kyoto-Tamba-doro (former the bypass of National Highway 9) to the Keiji Bypass.

To reduce congestion on the Meishin Expressway and respond to the need for a road network that could serve as a radial road and belt line in Kyoto City, the construction of the Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line was subsequently planned to connect the Kyoto-Tamba-doro (formerly the bypass of National Highway 9) to the Keiji Bypass.

To reduce congestion on the Meishin Expressway and respond to the need for a road network that could serve as a radial road and belt line in Kyoto City, the construction of the Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line was subsequently planned to connect the Kyoto-Tanba-doro (formerly the bypass of National Highway 9) to the Keiji Bypass.

sen.j: 京都縦貫自動車道と京都第二外環状道路は国道478号に指定され、一貫した整備が続けられている。
sen.e: The Kyoto Jukan-Jidoshado Expressway and the Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line were designated as National Highway 478 and their constructions have been consistently promoted.
The Kyoto Jukan-Jidoshado Expressway and the Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line were designated as National Highway 478, and their construction has been continuously promoted.
The Kyoto Jukan-Jidoshado Expressway and the Kyoto-daini-soto-kanjo-doro Belt Line were designated as National Highway 478, and their construction has been continuously promoted.

sen.j: 路線の表示では、利用者に分かり易い様、瀬田東JCT - 大山崎JCTにおいて京滋バイパスとされている。
sen.e: On traffic signs, the section between the Seta-Higashi Junction and the Oyamazaki Junction is named Keiji Bypass not to cause drivers confusion.
sen.cmt: わかりやすい、混乱させないようにと意訳してあります。
sen.e: On traffic signs, the section between the Seta-Higashi Junction and the Oyamazaki Junction is named Keiji Bypass so as to prevent confusion by drivers.
On traffic signs, the section between the Seta-Higashi Junction and the Oyamazaki Junction is identified as the Keiji Bypass so as to make it easier for drivers to understand the signs.
sen.cmt: so as to 以下 英訳しなおしt's difficult to know how to revise the translation after "so as to" unless some kind of indication is given about what the problem is. For example, is it the use of the word "confusion" for "分かり易い" or "drivers" for "利用者”? For the time being, I have assumed the problem is with the word "confusion".

sen.j: また、名神高速道路と京滋バイパスはどちらを経由しても料金およびETC割引制度に差はない。
sen.e: Whichever route is chosen, the Meishin expressway or the Keiji Bypass, the same toll and ETC commuter discount service is applied.
sen.cmt: 「なお」はとくに訳出していません。
sen.e: Whichever route is chosen--the Meishin Expressway or the Keiji Bypass--the same toll and ETC commuter discount service apply.
Whichever route is chosen--the Meishin Expressway or the Keiji Bypass--the same toll and ETC commuter discount service apply.

sen.j: ここでは、特記がない場合は営業路線名としての京滋バイパス（瀬田東ICから大山崎JCT）について述べる。
sen.e: The Keiji Bypass here means the service line called as such (between Seta-Higashi Junction and Oyamazaki Junction) unless otherwise specified.
The Keiji Bypass here means the service line known as such (between Seta-Higashi Junction and Oyamazaki Junction) unless otherwise specified.
The Keiji Bypass here means the service line known as such (between Seta-Higashi Interchange and Oyamazaki Junction) unless otherwise specified.

sen.j: この路線の宇治トンネルは国道1号の中で最も長い4,313メートルであり、トンネル内は宇治東IC、笠取IC手前500mを除き車線変更禁止である。
sen.e: The Uji Tunnel of this section is 4,313 meters long and the longest in the National Highway, and lane changes are prohibited in the tunnel except between the area 500 meters short of the Kasatori Interchange and the Ujihigashi Interchange.

The Uji Tunnel of this section is, at 4,313 meters, the longest on the National Highway; lane changes are prohibited in the tunnel except between the area 500 meters short of the Kasatori Interchange and the Ujihigashi Interchange.

The Uji Tunnel of this section is, at 4,313 meters, the longest on the National Highway; lane changes are prohibited in the tunnel except between the area 500 meters short of the Kasatori Interchange and the Ujihigashi Interchange.

sen.j: 久御山ジャンクション付近では開通前に映画『踊る大捜査線 THE MOVIE 2 レインボーブリッジを封鎖せよ!』の撮影が行われた。
sen.e: A Japanese famous movie titled "Odoru Daisosasen The MOVIE 2 Block up the Rainbow Bridge" was filmed around the Kumiyama Junction before it was opened.
A well-known Japanese movie called "Odoru Daisosasen The MOVIE 2: Block up the Rainbow Bridge" was filmed around the Kumiyama Junction before it was opened.
A well-known Japanese movie called "Odoru Daisosasen The MOVIE 2: Block up the Rainbow Bridge" was filmed around the Kumiyama Junction before it was opened.

sen.j: 瀬田東IC - 大山崎IC・JCTの距離は名神高速道路よりも京滋バイパスのほうが若干短く、最高速度通り走行した場合、京滋バイパス経由のほうが早く目的地に行ける。
sen.e: The distance between the Seta-higashi Junction and the Oyamazaki Interchange/Junction is slightly shorter in the Keiji Bypass than in Meishin Highway, which means that the Keiji Bypass takes drivers to their destination earlier than Meishin Highway if they keep to speed limits.

The distance between Seta-higashi Junction and Oyamazaki Interchange/Junction is slightly shorter in the Keiji Bypass than it is on the Meishin Highway, which means the Keiji Bypass takes drivers to their destinations earlier than Meishin Highway if they keep to the speed limits.

Because less distance is traveled between the Seta-higashi Junction and the Oyamazaki Interchange/Junction if drivers take the Keiji Bypass instead of the Meishin Highway, a driver driving at the speed limit on the Keiji Bypass will arrive at their destination more quickly than a driver driving at the speed limit on the Meishin Highway.
sen.cmt: The use of "would take" in the edited sentence makes it sound as if the focus of this sentence is that drivers are not keeping to the speed limit. Also, the edited sentence doesn't include any information about the distance being shorter. I've rewritten the sentence to fix these problems.I've had to rewrite this quite a bit to try and communicate what I think the Japanese is trying to say but really more information needs to be provided for non-Japanese readers. It will not be immediately apparent to them that, because the speed limit on the Meishin Highway is higher than that on the Keiji Bypass, most people would assume that travelling on the highway would get you to your destination more quickly than traveling on the bypass.

sen.j: またサービスエリアなどの休憩施設がないため、名神高速のほうが混雑することが多い（名神高速道路の瀬田東 - 大山崎の休憩施設は大津サービスエリア、桂川パーキングエリアの2カ所がある）。
sen.e: The Keiji Bypass with no facility for resting such as rest service areas is less congested than the Meishin Expressway, (which has 2 rest areas, Otsu Rest Area and Ktsuragawa Rest Area between Setahigashi and Oyamazaki.

The Keiji Bypass with no rest service areas or other such facilities, so it's less congested than the Meishin Expressway (which has two rest areas: Otsu Rest Area and Ktsuragawa Rest Area between Setahigashi and Oyamazaki.

The Keiji Bypass has no rest service areas or other such facilities, so it's less congested than the Meishin Expressway (which has two rest areas: Otsu Rest Area and Katsuragawa Rest Area between Setahigashi and Oyamazaki.)
sen.cmt: 文法スペルミスを修正括弧抜け

sen.j: しかし、瀬田東・大山崎両JCTが名神の後付けで設置された構造である（特に大山崎JCTの構造は極めて複雑なものになっている）が故にランプ (高速道路)部で減速運転となってしまう。
sen.e: However, because of the desgin of both the Seto-higashia and Oyamazaki Junctions, which requries a ramp (in highway lanes) to connect them to the Meishin Highway (in particular quite complicated design of the Oyamazaki jucntion), drivers have to reduce their speed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, due to the design of both the Seto-higashia and Oyamazaki junctions, which require ramps (in the highway lanes) to connect them to the Meishin Highway (in particular the very complicated design of the Oyamazaki junction), drivers have to reduce their speed.

However, due to the design of both the Seto-higashia and Oyamazaki junctions, which require ramps (in the highway lanes) to connect them to the Meishin Highway (in particular the very complicated design of the Oyamazaki junction), drivers have to reduce their speed.

sen.j: 大山崎JCTから吹田・大阪方面へ向かう場合に名神高速道路左ルートとの合流で渋滞することがあるという欠点がある。
sen.e: Another disadvantage is that drivers often encounter congestions in merging into the left lane of the Meishin Highway from the Oyamada Junction toward Suita or Osaka.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Another disadvantage is that drivers often encounter congestion as they attempt to merge into the left lane of the Meishin Highway from the Oyamada Junction toward Suita or Osaka.
Another disadvantage is that drivers often encounter congestion as they attempt to merge into the left lane of the Meishin Highway from the Oyamazaki Junction toward Suita or Osaka.

sen.j: また、途中、カーブや坂道が連続していて、それらを敬遠するドライバーも少なくない事から、名神高速道路のバイパスとしては十分に機能していない。
sen.e: Also not a few driver dislike a lot of winding areas and slopes along the Keiji Bypass, thus the Keiji Bypass does not perform its function as a bypass completely.
Moreover, many drivers dislike the winding areas and slopes along the Keiji Bypass, so the Keiji Bypass does not fully perform its function as a bypass.
Moreover, many drivers dislike the winding areas and slopes along the Keiji Bypass, so the Keiji Bypass doesn't fully perform its function as a bypass.

sen.j: また、この道路は国道1号（一般国道）のバイパスであるので自動車専用道路であり、高速自動車国道ではない。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is a bypass of Nationa Highway 1 (general National highway), which means that it is not a expressway but a motor highway.
Furthermore, it's a bypass of National Highway 1 (a general national highway), which means it isn't a expressway but a motor highway.
Furthermore, it's a bypass of National Highway 1 (a general national highway), which means it isn't a expressway but a motor highway.

sen.j: 宇治川東側から吹田・大阪方面の京滋バイパスにのる場合、宇治西ICまで行かなければならない。
sen.e: When drivers want to get on the Keiji Byapss toward Suita or Osak from the east side of the Uji-gawa River (near the Ujihigashi Interchange), they must go to the Ujinishi Interchagne.
When drivers want to get on the Keiji Byapss toward Suita or Osaka from the east side of the Uji-gawa River (near the Ujihigashi Interchange), they must go to the Ujinishi Interchange.
When drivers want to get on the Keiji Bypass toward Suita or Osaka from the east side of the Uji-gawa River (near the Ujihigashi Interchange), they must go to the Ujinishi Interchange.

sen.j: 宇治東ICがハーフICであるからである。
sen.e: This is because the Ujihigashi Interchage is a half interchagne.
This is because the Ujihigashi Interchange is a half-interchagne.
This is because the Ujihigashi Interchange is a half-interchange.

sen.j: そのため、通勤時間帯は宇治東ICと宇治西IC間の一般道路部が渋滞することが多い。
sen.e: As a result, local roads linking the Ujihigashi Interchage and the Ujinishi Interchange are commmonly congested during rush hours.
As a result, local roads linking the Ujihigashi and Ujinishi interchanges are commonly congested during the rush hours.
As a result, local roads linking the Ujihigashi and Ujinishi interchanges are commonly congested during the rush hours.

sen.j: この一般道路部はVICSリンク未対応区間であるため、渋滞回避予測がしにくい。
sen.e: This area is outside VICS (Vehicle Information and Communication System) links zone, which makes it difficult for drivers to use their congestion avoidance scheme.
This area is outside the VICS (Vehicle Information and Communication System) link zone, which makes it difficult for drivers to use their congestion-avoidance schemes.
This area is outside the VICS (Vehicle Information and Communication System) link zone, which makes it difficult for drivers to use their congestion-avoidance schemes.

sen.j: 上側が起点側、下側が終点側。
sen.e: The upper is nearer to the origin; the lower is nearer to the termination.
The upper is nearer to the origin, while the lower is nearer to the termination point.
The upper is nearer to the origin, while the lower is nearer to the termination point.

sen.j: 左側が上り側、右側が下り側。
sen.e: The left is nearer to Tokyo, the right is farther from Tokyo
The left is nearer to Tokyo, while the right is farther from Tokyo.
The left is nearer to Tokyo, while the right is farther from Tokyo.
